security: Disclosing the operational interest in McVickar and the intention to recruit him for intelligence activities could expose the CIA's methods of identifying and approaching potential assets, compromising future recruitment efforts. Additionally, revealing McVickar's potential role as a 'spotter' and recruiter could endanger him and his contacts, as well as damage the CIA's relationship with Trans World Airline (TWA).
summary: This file contains documents related to John Augustus McVickar Jr., including a review determining his suitability as an unwitting collaborator and dispatches discussing his potential recruitment by the CIA due to his extensive contacts and position with Trans World Airline in Paris.
summary_one_paragraph: This collection of documents, spanning from 1949 to 1976, centers on John Augustus McVickar Jr., a U.S. citizen working in Paris with Trans World Airline (TWA). The file includes a review categorizing him as a potential unwitting collaborator (later changed), along with dispatches from 1949 detailing the CIA's interest in recruiting McVickar for intelligence work. He is viewed as a valuable asset due to his broad network of contacts, including prominent figures in business, government, and the arts, and his ability to easily integrate into various social circles. The dispatches discuss strategies for approaching McVickar, supplementing his income to retain him at TWA, and utilizing him as a 'spotter' and recruiter of other potential agents.
title: McVickar John A.
